name: GL Tutorial in WebGL 1.0
tagline: WebGL 1.0 translation of C++/OpenGL code examples from Jason L. McKesson's book "Learning Modern 3D Graphics Programming"
body:
This is a [WebGL 1.0](a href="https://www.khronos.org/webgl/)
translation of C++/OpenGL code examples from Jason L. McKesson's book
[Learning Modern 3D Graphics Programming](https://paroj.github.io/gltut/).

It's a work in progress. Below is the list of examples translated so far.
Use browser's `View Source` to see example's GLSL and GL code or browse
the repo on GitHub.

### I. The Basics
  - [Hello, Triangle!](tut/01/)
  - Playing with Colors
    * [Fragment Position Display](tut/02a/)
    * [Vertex Attributes](tut/02b/)

### II. Positioning
  - OpenGL's Moving Triangle
    * [Moving the Vertices](tut/03a/)
    * [A Better Way](tut/03b/)
    * [More Power to the Shaders](tut/03c/)
    * [Multiple Shaders](tut/03d/)
  - Objects at Rest
    * [The Unreal World](tut/04a/)
    * [Perspective Projection](tut/04b/)
    * [The Matrix has You](tut/04c/)
    * [Aspect of the World](tut/04d/)
  - Objects in Depth
    * [Multiple Objects in OpenGL](tut/05a/)
    * Optimization: Base Vertex
    * [Overlap and Depth Buffering](tut/05c/)
    * [Boundaries and Clipping](tut/05d/)
    * Depth Clamping
  - Objects in Motion
    * [Translation](tut/06a/)
    * [Scale](tut/06b/)
    * [Rotation](tut/06c/)
    * [Fun with Matrices](tut/06d)
